00110 // this struct works with any user defined type that conforms to the
00111 // serialization concept as defined in SerializedFile.h 
00112 //
00113 // This doesn't work with built in types, but there are specializations
00114 // defined below which work for those.
00115 template <class T>
00116 struct record {
00117         enum { size = T::record_size };
00118         
00119         static inline 
00120         const unsigned char * const deserialize(const unsigned char * const buffer) 
00121         { 
00122                 return buffer; 
00123         }
00124         
00125         static inline 
00126         void serialize(const T &var, unsigned char * buffer) 
00127         { 
00128                 var.Serialize(buffer);
00129         }
00130 };
00131 
00132 // specialize for pointers in a braindead way.. but at least it
00133 // will compile
00134 template <class T>
00135 struct record <T *> {
00136         enum { size = 0 };
00137         
00138         static inline 
00139         T * deserialize(const unsigned char * const buffer) 
00140         { 
00141                 assert(0 && "you should not serialize pointers");
00142                 return NULL;
00143         }
00144 };

00149 // used to define specializations for intrinsic types
00150 #define RECORD_DEFS(T)                                                                          \
00151 template <>                                                                                                     \
00152 struct record<T> {                                                                                      \
00153         enum { size = sizeof(T) };                                                              \
00154                                                                                                                         \
00155         static inline                                                                                   \
00156         T deserialize(const unsigned char * const buffer)               \
00157         {                                                                                                               \
00158                 return *((T*)buffer);                                                           \
00159         }                                                                                                               \
00160                                                                                                                         \
00161         static inline                                                                                   \
00162         void serialize(const T &var, unsigned char *  buffer)   \
00163         {                                                                                                               \
00164                 *((T*)buffer) = var;                                                            \
00165         }                                                                                                               \
00166 };
00167 
00168 // this probably takes care of all the intrinsics.. 
00169 RECORD_DEFS(char);
00170 RECORD_DEFS(unsigned char);
00171 RECORD_DEFS(short int);
00172 RECORD_DEFS(unsigned short int);
00173 RECORD_DEFS(int);
00174 RECORD_DEFS(unsigned int);
00175 RECORD_DEFS(long);
00176 RECORD_DEFS(unsigned long);
00177 RECORD_DEFS(long long);
00178 RECORD_DEFS(unsigned long long);

00180 
00181 #undef RECORD_DEFS
